alert.note: Alert for Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 4:49AM EST until January 13 at 4:17AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Wakefield VA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Virginia... Nottoway River Near Stony Creek affecting Sussex County. For the Chowan Basin...including Rawlings, Stony Creek, Sebrell, Lawrenceville, Emporia, Franklin...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Nottoway River near Stony Creek. * WHEN...From this morning to early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Lowlands between the town of Stony Creek and VA Route 640, along both sides of VA Route 40, are flooded. Also, flood waters from the Nottoway River back up into Stony Creek and flood Main Street between Halifax Road and Cedar Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 13.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this morning to 16.2 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall tomorrow morning. It will rise to 16.3 feet early Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Friday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.3 feet on 05/22/1954. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 300 PM EST.
